intro: Selinum simplex, commonly known as slender wormwood, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. The plant has narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky soils. Selinum simplex is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
